title: Contributing to Our Project
text: find bug, feature request, need help, please open issue GitHub. submitting issue, provide: - clear descriptive title. - Steps reproduce problem. - Expected vs.Â actual behavior. - relevant error messages, logs, screenshots. - Information environment (OS, software versions, etc.). review pull requests within 7 days.

title: Contributing to Our Project
text: submitting pull request (PR): 1. Fork repository create branch. 2. Ensure changes follow projectâ€™s coding standards. 3. Test changes thoroughly. 4. Write clear commit messages. 5. Open pull request descriptive title summary changes. 6. Tag maintainer team member review.

title: Contributing to Our Project
text: least one team member must review pull request merging. Address reviewer comments make necessary updates. approved, maintainer merge PR main.

title: Introduction to heartpredictr package
text: heartpredictr package provides set functions processing, analyzing, visualizing heart attack risk data. tutorial guide using package complete analysis workflow, including data cleaning, visualization, feature analysis, model preparation. functions designed specifically heart attack risk data can also applied similar health risk analysis scenarios.

title: Introduction to heartpredictr package
text: can install development version GitHub using: cloned repository locally, can install root folder using: can also check whether installed successfully Console. â€™s installed, output returns TRUE.

title: Introduction to heartpredictr package
text: heartpredictr package provides simple yet effective toolkit analyzing preprocessing heart attack risk data. package, can: Clean prepare heart attack risk data Create intuitive correlation visualizations Identify significant variables related heart attack risk Prepare data model building analysis functions specifically designed handle common features issues heart attack risk datasets, making analysis process streamlined standardized.

what: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
title: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
text: ðŸ“¦ helper package heart attack risk prediction India heartpredictr R package provides reusable tested helper functions support data preprocessing, visualization, variable selection building heart attack risk prediction models. designed modularity, reproducibility, ease use health data science workflows, particularly focused epidemiological modeling Indian context.

title: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
text: Install development version GitHub using:

title: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
text: package currently includes four key functions: clean_heart_data() â€” Cleans raw heart data converts relevant variables factors. prepare_heart_data() â€” Loads splits data train/test sets, error handling. create_correlation_heatmap() â€” Generates correlation heatmap numeric/factor data. get_significant_variables() â€” Returns significant predictors based logistic regression. function handles errors gracefully tested using testthat.

title: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
code: library(heartpredictr)  # Load and prepare sample heart data data_path <- "data/heart_attack.csv" splits <- prepare_heart_data(data_path, target_col = "Heart_Attack_Risk", train_ratio = 0.7)  # Clean the training data train_clean <- clean_heart_data(splits$train_data)  # Visualize correlation create_correlation_heatmap(train_clean)  # Get significant variables get_significant_variables(train_clean, target = "Heart_Attack_Risk", p_thresh = 0.05)

title: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
text: package developed part DSCI 310 course UBC support group project heart attack risk prediction India, based Kaggle dataset.

title: Functions for Heart Attack Risk Prediction
text: functions include unit integration tests using testthat. GitHub Actions configured automatically run tests push (CI).
